# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load in 

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Input data files are available in the "../input/" directory.
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# Any results you write to the current directory are saved as output.
source.eb002d82:
plt.scatter(auto["displacement"], auto.mpg, c=auto.cylinders, s=389,
            alpha=0.5)
plt.colorbar();
plt.xlabel("Displacement")
plt.ylabel("Miles Per Gallon")
plt.title("MPG consumed per Displacement")
plt.show()
source.3191ed06:
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.scatter(auto.displacement, auto.mpg)
ax.set_xlabel("Displacement")
ax.set_ylabel("Miles Per Gallon")
ax.set_title("Example Scatter Plot")
plt.show()
source.a26bda6f:
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.hist(auto.displacement, label="Displacement", bins=5)
ax.set_xlabel("Displacement")
ax.set_ylabel("Number of Observations")
plt.show()
source.1851ccc5:
bins=[50, 150, 250, 350, 450]
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.hist(auto.displacement, label="Displacement", bins=bins)
ax.set_xlabel("Displacement")
ax.set_ylabel("Number of Observations")
plt.show()
source.6d5556f4:
import seaborn as sns
sns.set_palette("RdBu")
sns.countplot(x="cylinders", data=auto)
plt.show()
source.dae34ce5:
sns.relplot(x="displacement", y="mpg",data=auto, col="cylinders",
            row="origin",
            kind="scatter")
plt.show()
source.3c387fef:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
sns.set_palette("RdBu")
correlation=auto.corr()
sns.heatmap(correlation)
plt.show()
